name: All Quizzes Great And Small | Thematic Fun | 10 Questions

questions.text: This 'great' observation plane accompanied the Enola Gay on it's bombing mission to Hiroshima. What was it called?
questions.explanation:
The Great Artiste.

	The world's first atomic bomb, used in war, was dropped on Hiroshima in Japan, on August 6th 1945.

questions.text: Who was nicknamed 'The Great Bird of the Galaxy' ?
questions.explanation:
Gene Roddenberry.

	Gene Roddenberry was born on August 21st 1921, in El Paso, Texas. His family moved to California before he was two years old. The rest is inter galactic history.

questions.text: 'Great Caesar's Ghost!' was which comic character's favorite exclamation?
questions.explanation:
Perry White.

	Perry White was the editor of the Daily Planet in the Superman comic books.

questions.text: Playwright George S. Kaufman wrote most of his plays with coauthors. What nickname was he given as a result of this?
questions.explanation:
The Great Collaborator.

	Among his many works, Kaufman wrote 'You Can't Take It With You' with Moss Hart, which won the Pullitzer Prize.

questions.text: Which turn of the century political figure was called 'The Great Commoner' ?
questions.explanation:
William Jennings Bryan.

	Bryan was born in Salem, Illinois, on March 19 1860 and went on to lose three presidential elections, 1896, 1900 and 1908. His policies and vocal support for the common man earned him his nickname.

questions.text: What was the nickname given to comic actor Buster Keaton ?
questions.explanation:
The Great Stone Face.

	Buster Keaton was born Joseph Frank Keaton. The name Buster was supposedly given to him by his godfather, Harry Houdini, who, upon catching him as he fell down a flight of stairs said, 'What a buster your kid took'.

questions.text: The life of Ferdinand Demara was the subject of a 1960 film starring Tony Curtis. The title of the film was Ferdinand's nickname. What was it ?
questions.explanation:
'The Great Impostor'.

	Ferdinand Demara successfully masqueraded as a monk, prison warden, surgeon and marine.

questions.text: Which former fashion model started a rock group called 'The Great Society' ?
questions.explanation:
Grace Slick.

	Grace Slick went on to front Jefferson Airplane, later renamed Jefferson Starship.

questions.text: Which sitcom's debut episode was named 'The Great Debate' ?
questions.explanation:
'Welcome Back, Kotter,'.

	The series first aired on September 9th 1975.

questions.text: Which Christmas classic had the original working title 'The Greatest Gift' ?
questions.explanation:
'It's a Wonderful Life'.

	Directed by Frank Capra and starring James Stewart and Donna Reed, 'It's a Wonderful Life' was released in 1946.
